intro: Gymnocalycium ambatoense subsp. plesnikii, commonly known as the Ambato moon cactus, is a member of the Cactaceae family native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a small, globular cactus with a short, thick stem and a single, often spiny areole. The plant produces pale yellow to orange flowers during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with a thick, water-storing stem. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for cactus enthusiasts.
